title: Parties to the Cartagena Protocol on Biosafety

questions.title: Is your country a party to the Cartagena Protocol on Biosafety (CPB)?
If your country is not a party to the Cartagena Protocol on Biosafety, has you initiated any national process to become a party?
You can provide more details here

title: Article 2-General Provisions
description: Article 2 requires each contracting party to take necessary and appropriate legal, administrative and other measures for fulfilling its obligations under this Protocol.

questions.title: Has your country taken the necessary national measures to implement the "Protocol"?

options.title: National measures have been fully adopted
Only temporary measures have been taken

questions.title: What specific instruments has your country developed to implement national biosafety measures? (please select all that apply)

options.title: One or more national biosafety laws
One or more national biosafety regulations
One or more sets of biosafety guidelines
Other laws, regulations or guidelines that indirectly apply to biosafety

questions.title: Has your country taken measures to mainstream biosafety into the national biodiversity strategy and action plan and other policies or legislation?
Has your country established a budget allocation mechanism for operating national biosafety measures?
Does your country have permanent staff to manage functions directly related to biosafety?
If your answer to the 18th question is yes, how many permanent staff members whose functions are directly related to biosafety?
Are there enough people?
You can provide more details on the implementation of Article 2 in your country here

title: Article 5-Drugs

questions.title: Does your country regulate the transboundary movement, handling or use of living modified organisms as medicines?
You can provide more details on the implementation of Article 5 in your country here

title: Article 6-Transit and Confined Use

questions.title: Does your country regulate the transit of living modified organisms?
Does your country regulate the enclosed use of living modified organisms?
Has your country made a decision regarding the import of living modified organisms for contained use?
You can provide more details on the implementation of Article 6 in your country

title: Articles 7 to 10-prior informed consent (AIA) and intentional introduction of living modified organisms into the environment

questions.title: Does your country have established legal requirements for exporters under its jurisdiction to notify the importing party’s national authority in writing before the intentional transboundary movement of living modified organisms falling within the scope of the prior informed consent procedure? ?
As the exporting party, has your country established legal requirements for the accuracy of the information contained in the notification provided by the exporter?

options.title: Not applicable (Parties are not currently exporting living modified organisms)

questions.title: During the reporting period, has your country received notifications about intentional transboundary movements of living modified organisms intended to be introduced into the environment?
If your answer to the 29th question is Yes, does the notification contain complete information (at least the information specified in Annex I of the Cartagena Protocol on Biosafety)?
If your answer to question 29 is Yes, will your country confirm receipt of the notification to the notifier within 90 days of receiving the notification?
If your answer to question 29 is yes, has your country notified the following parties of its decision?
Notification person
Biosafety Information Clearing House (BCH)?

During the reporting period, did your country make a decision on the notification of intentional transboundary movement of LMOs for the intentional introduction of living modified organisms into the environment?
If your answer to question 33 is yes, how many kinds of living modified organisms that your country has approved for the purpose of introducing into the environment?
If your answer to Question 34 is that Living Modified Organisms have been approved, are all approved LMOs Has it been actually imported into your country?
If your answer to the 33rd question is yes, what percentage is the percentage of the following categories in your country? (please select all that apply)

options.title: Allow unconditional import/use of living modified organisms
Allow conditional import/use of living modified organisms
Import/Use of Living Modified Organisms Prohibited
Inform the notifier of the decision to postpone the notification

questions.title: If your answer to Question 36 is your country’s decision to approve conditional import or prohibit import, your country Did you explain the reasons on which the decision was based?

You can provide more details on the implementation of Articles 7 to 10 in your country here, including possible actions when there is no scientific certainty about the potential adverse effects of the intentional introduction of living modified organisms into the environment measure

title: Article 11-Procedures concerning living modified organisms intended for direct use as food or feed, or for processing purposes

questions.title: Does your country have laws, regulations or administrative measures to decide on the domestic use (including placing on the market) of living modified organisms that are moved across borders and intended for direct use as food or feed or for processing? ?

Does your country stipulate the accuracy of the information provided by the applicant regarding the domestic use (including placing on the market) of living modified organisms that may be transboundary and intended for direct use as food or feed or for processing? Legal requirements?
During the period of this report, your country has made relevant decisions regarding the <u>domestic use</u> (including market Put) How many decisions have you made?
Does your country have laws, regulations or administrative measures to make decisions on the import of living modified organisms intended for direct use as food or feed or for processing?
During the reporting period, how many decisions have your country made regarding the <u>import</u> of living modified organisms intended for direct use as food or feed or for processing?

You can provide more details on the implementation of Article 11 in your country here, including any potential adverse effects on living modified organisms intended to be directly used as food or feed or for processing that may be transboundary. Possible measures for scientific certainty

title: Article 12-Review of Decisions

questions.title: Has your country established a mechanism for reviewing and changing the decisions it has made regarding the intentional transboundary movement of living modified organisms?
During the reporting period, has your country reviewed and/or changed its decisions regarding the intentional transboundary movement of living modified organisms?
If your answer to question 46 is yes, how many decisions have you reviewed and/or changed?
If your answer to question 46 is yes, is there any review triggered by the request of the exporting party or the notifier?
If your answer to the 48th question is yes, did your country respond within 90 days and explain the reasons for the decision?
If your answer to question 46 is yes, is there any review initiated by your country as the importing party?
If your answer to the 50th question is yes, did your country explain the reasons for the decision and notify you within 30 days
Notification person
Biosafety Information Clearing House
You can provide more details on the implementation of Article 12 in your country here

title: Article 13-Simplified Procedure

questions.title: Has your country established an application system for the simplified procedures for the intentional transboundary movement of living modified organisms?

If your answer to question 54 is yes, has your country notified the contracting parties about the application of this simplified procedure through the Biosafety Clearing House?

title: Articles 15 and 16-Risk Assessment and Risk Management

Imported living modified organisms intended to be directly used as food or feed or for processing
Decision on the domestic use (including market placement) of living modified organisms that may be subject to transboundary movement and intended for direct use as food or feed or for processing
Imported Living Modified Organisms for Contained Use

questions.title: Has your country established a mechanism for conducting risk assessments before making decisions related to living modified organisms?

You can provide more details on the implementation of Article 15 and Article 16 in your country here

title: Article 17-Unintentional transboundary movement <sup>2</sup> and emergency measures
footnote: <sup>2</sup> According to the working definition adopted by decision CP-VIII/16, "'unintentionally caused transboundary movement' refers to the inadvertent crossing of the border of a certain contracting party, Transboundary movement resulting in the release of living modified organisms. The provisions of Article 17 of the Protocol shall be applied to such transboundary movement only when the living modified organism in question may have a significant harmful effect on the conservation and sustainable use of biological diversity, taking into account the affected or possible Human health risks in affected countries".

questions.title: Does your country have established measures to exchange biosafety information to affected or likely to be affected countries and biosafety information when a certain release within its jurisdiction will cause or may cause unintentional transboundary movement? So, as appropriate, issue notices to relevant international organizations?

During the reporting period, how many times did the release of living modified organisms that caused or may cause unintentional transboundary movements occurred within the jurisdiction of your country?

If your answer to Question 86 is released, has your country notified affected or likely affected countries, The Biosafety Clearing House and inform relevant international organizations as appropriate?
Does your country have the ability to take appropriate measures to deal with unintentional transboundary movements?
During the reporting period, how many times did your country become aware of unintentional transboundary movements into its territory?

title: 第 18 条 – 处理、运输、包装和标志

questions.title: 贵国是否参照有关国际规则和标准，采取措施要求在安全的条件下处理、包装和运输属于拟越境转移的改性活生物体 ？
贵国是否采取措施要求拟直接作食物或饲料或加工之用的改性活生物体所附单据，在 改性活生物体名称 无法获知的情况下明确说明其中 可能含有改性活生物体 且不打算有意将其引入环境，并附上供进一步获取信息的联络点？
贵国是否采取措施要求拟直接作食物或饲料或加工之用的改性活生物体所附单据，在 改性活生物体名称 获知的情况下明确说明其中 含有改性活生物体 且不打算有意将其引入环境，并附上供进一步获取信息的联络点？

作为其他单据的一部分（并非专门的改性活生物体的）

questions.title: 贵国是否采取措施要求 预定用于封闭使用的改性活生物体 所附单据明确将其标明为 改性活生物体 ，并具体说明安全处理、储存、运输和使用的任何要求，以及供进一步索取信息的联络点（包括接收改性活生物体的个人和机构名称和地址）？

options.title: As part of other documents (not dedicated to living modified organisms)

questions.title: 贵国是否采取措施要求 有意向进口缔约方环境中引入的改性活生物体 所附单据明确将其标明为 改性活生物体；具体说明其名称和相关特性和/或特点、关于安全处理、储存、运输和使用的任何要求以及供进一步索取信息的联络点，并酌情提供进口者和出口者名称和地址；以及列出关于所涉转移符合本《议定书》中适用于出口者的规定的声明？

title: 第22条——能力建设

questions.title: 贵国是否拥有可预见和可靠的资金来进行能力建设以有效实施《议定书》？
贵国是否在开发和/或加强生物安全人力资源和机构能力方面得到了外部支持，或受益于与其他缔约方的共同行动？
若您对第125个问题的回答为 是 ，那么，贵国是如何提供这些资源的？（请选择所有适用项）

在本报告所述期间，贵国是否启动过任何程序来获得全球环境基金（全环基金）的资金以开展生物安全方面的能力建设？
若您对第129个问题的回答为 是 ，您如何描述这一程序？
